title: What is a stalemate in chess? When this type of situation occurs, then how the result of game is decided? - Quora

response.answer_text: A stalemate is a situation when the king of the player whose turn it is, is not in check (i.e, is not being threatened by an enemy piece), but has no squares to go to (all possible squares being covered by enemy pieces), and no other legal move can be made by him, either because he has no pieces, the pieces are blocked, or the pieces are pinned (i.e if they moved, the king would be in check.) In such a case, the game is declared to be a draw, as no move can be made and yet the king is safe where he is. Each player gets half a point each.
